packages.name: stan
packages.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides the capability to connect with NATS Streaming server and performs the 
below functionalities.

- Point to point communication (Queues)
- Pub/Sub (Topics)
- Request/Reply

### Basic Usage

#### Setting up the connection

First step is setting up the connection with the NATS Streaming server. The following ways can be used to connect to a
NATS Streaming server.

1. Connect to a server using the URL
```ballerina
stan:Client newClient = checkpanic new("nats://localhost:4222");
```

2. Connect to one or more servers with a custom configuration
```ballerina
stan:Client newClient = checkpanic new({"nats://serverone:4222", "nats://servertwo:4222"},  config);
```

#### Publishing messages

Publishing messages is handled differently in the NATS Basic server and Streaming server. The 'ballerina/nats' module provides different 
APIs to publish messages to NATS Streaming server.

##### Publishing messages to the NATS Streaming server

Once connected, publishing is accomplished via one of the below two methods.

1. Publish with the subject and the message content.
```ballerina
string message = "hello world";
stan:Error? result = producer->publishMessage({ content: message, subject: "demo" });
```

#### Listening to incoming messages

##### Listening to messages from a Streaming server

```ballerina
// Initializes the NATS Streaming listener.
listener stan:Listener subscription = new;

// Binds the consumer to listen to the messages published to the 'demo' subject.
@stan:ServiceConfig {
    subject: "demo"
}
service demo on subscription {

    resource function onMessage(stan:Message msg, stan:Caller caller) {
    }


}
```

>**Note:** The default thread pool size used in Ballerina is the number of processors available * 2. You can configure the thread pool size by using the `BALLERINA_MAX_POOL_SIZE` environment variable.

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below **Functions**. 

For examples on the usage of the connector, see the following.
* [Basic Streaming Publisher and Subscriber Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/nats-streaming-client.html)
* [Streaming Publisher and Subscriber With Data Binding Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/nats-streaming-consumer-with-data-binding.html)
* [Durable Subscriptions Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/nats-streaming-durable-subscriptions.html)
* [Queue Groups Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/nats-streaming-queue-group.html)
* [Historical Message Replay Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/nats-streaming-start-position.html)
packages.summary:
This module provides the capability to connect with NATS Streaming server and performs the
below functionalities.

fields.name: username
fields.description: The username for basic authentication

fields.name: password
fields.description: The password for basic authentication

fields.name: content
fields.description: The message content

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The subject to which the message was sent to

records.name: Message
records.description: Represents the message, which a NATS server sends to its subscribed services.

fields.name: trustStore
fields.description: Configurations associated with the TrustStore

fields.name: keyStore
fields.description: Configurations associated with the KeyStore

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: The standard name of the requested protocol

records.name: SecureSocket
records.description: Configurations related to facilitating a secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Name of the subject to which it is subscribed to

fields.name: queueGroup
fields.description: The name of the queue group to which the subscription belongs to

fields.name: durableName
fields.description: If set, this will survive client restarts

fields.name: maxInFlight
fields.description:
The number of messages the cluster will have in-flight
                  without an ACK

fields.name: ackWaitInSeconds
fields.description:
The time (in seconds) the cluster will wait for an
                          ACK for a given message

fields.name: subscriptionTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description:
The time (in seconds) the subscription
                          will wait if a network failure occurs during
                          the creation of it

fields.name: autoAck
fields.description: if false, should manually ack the message

fields.name: startPosition
fields.description: The position to start receiving messages

records.name: ServiceConfigData
records.description: The configurations for the NATS streaming subscription.

fields.name: ackTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description:
Timeout (in seconds) to wait for an acknowledgement
                          for the corresponding subscription

fields.name: connectionTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: Timeout (in seconds) to wait for a connection

fields.name: maxPubAcksInFlight
fields.description:
The maximum number of published ACKs that may be
                          in flight at any point of time

fields.name: discoverPrefix
fields.description: Subject prefix used for server discovery

fields.name: pingIntervalInMinutes
fields.description:
The interval (in minutes) between the attempts
                          of pinging the server

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Configurations related to authentication

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: Configurations related to SSL/TLS

records.name: StreamingConfig
records.description: Configuration related to establishing a streaming connection.

fields.name: token
fields.description: The token for token-based authentication

records.name: Tokens
records.description: Configurations related to token based authentication.

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `nats:Error` upon failure to acknowledge the server

remoteMethods.name: ack
remoteMethods.description: Acknowledges the NATS streaming server upon the receipt of the message.

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `nats:Error` upon failure to acknowledge the server

methods.name: ack
methods.description: Acknowledges the NATS streaming server upon the receipt of the message.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message to be published

returnParameters.description:
The `string` value representing the NUID (NATS Unique Identifier) of the published message if the
           message gets successfully published and acknowledged by the NATS server,
           a `stan:Error` with NUID and `message` fields in case an error occurs in publishing, the timeout
           elapses while waiting for the acknowledgement, or else
           a `stan:Error` only with the `message` field in case an error occurs even before publishing
           is completed

remoteMethods.name: publishMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Publishes data to a given subject.
```ballerina string|error result = newClient->publishMessage(<@untainted>message);```

parameters.name: url
parameters.description:
The NATS Broker URL. For a clustered use case, pass the URL
                      as a string array.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the client

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cluster configured in the NATS server

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message to be published

returnParameters.description:
The `string` value representing the NUID (NATS Unique Identifier) of the published message if the
           message gets successfully published and acknowledged by the NATS server,
           a `stan:Error` with NUID and `message` fields in case an error occurs in publishing, the timeout
           elapses while waiting for the acknowledgement, or else
           a `stan:Error` only with the `message` field in case an error occurs even before publishing
           is completed

methods.name: publishMessage
methods.description:
Publishes data to a given subject.
```ballerina string|error result = newClient->publishMessage(<@untainted>message);```

clients.name: Client
clients.description: The streaming client provides the capability to publish messages to the NATS streaming server.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Type descriptor of the service

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the service

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `nats:Error` upon failure to register the listener

parameters.name: url
parameters.description:
The NATS Broker URL. For a clustered use case, pass the URL
                      as a string array.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description:
The unique identifier of the client. The `clientId` should be unique across all the subscriptions.
             Therefore, multilpe subscription services cannot be bound to a single listener

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cluster configured in the NATS server. The default value is `test-cluster`

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Type descriptor of the service

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the service

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `nats:Error` upon failure to register the listener

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description:
Represents the NATS streaming server connection to which a subscription service should be bound in order to
receive messages of the corresponding subscription.

constants.name: FIRST
constants.description: Specifies that message delivery should begin with the oldest available message for this subject.

constants.name: LAST_RECEIVED
constants.description: Specifies that message delivery should start with the last (most recent) message stored for this subject.

constants.name: NEW_ONLY
constants.description: Specifies that message delivery should start with the messages, which are published after the subscription is created.

annotations.name: ServiceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation, which is used to configure the streaming subscription.

errors.name: Error
errors.description: The union of the NATS module related errors.

errors.name: StanError
errors.description: Represents the NATS module related errors.

types.name: SequenceNumber
types.description: Specifies that message delivery should start at the given sequence number.

types.name: StartPosition
types.description: Specifies the position to start receiving messages.

types.name: TimeDeltaStart
types.description: Specifies that message delivery should start with a given historical time delta (from now).
